byline.contributor: Ashley Southall and Ken Schwencke contributed reporting from New York. Alan Blinder contributed from Charleston, Michael Schmidt from Washington and Kate Zernike from New Jersey.

abstract: Newly discovered website registered by Dylann Roof gives first serious look into his thinking in period leading up to massacre that claimed nine lives in Charleston, SC; site features some 60 photographs that illustrate Roof's fixation with Confederate imagery, slavery and white supremacy; also includes manifesto, perhaps authored by Roof, that criticizes blacks as inferior and calls for white supremacist militancy.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Roof can be seen posing with weapons, visiting Confederate graves and burning an American flag.

headline.main: Dylann Roof Photos and a Manifesto Are Posted on Website
headline.print_headline: Roof’s Photos Appear on Site With Manifesto

snippet: Mr. Roof can be seen posing with weapons, visiting Confederate graves and burning an American flag.

keywords.value: Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church (Charleston, SC)
